title: BitcoinGirl.Club
author: BitcoinGirl.Club
content: No I am not. My men Theymos and Cyrus, What is going on?Since I logged in earlier, it keep coming when navigating to pages.. No idea if I will be able to post the topic as I do normally. Are we running out of resources or it's something new that is applied as a restriction? We had newbie jail, I guess it's not something to do with Legendary jail LOL

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: If the mentioned on the page is not what you are doing, then you might be using TOR? or having multiple tab opens? Because 503 error code mean is overloaded for the requests (multiple requests) the server is receiving at the that time. Also what is newbie jail just heard it lol.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on December 14, 2022, 07:37:50 AMIf the mentioned on the page is not what you are doing, then you might be using TOR? or having multiple tab opens? I am using TOR and not multiple tab opened. It was so annoying that I had to log out and now logged in again after long time. There was something with the server, let's see how the next hour works for me.QuoteBecause 503 error code mean is overloaded for the requests (multiple requests) the server is receiving at the that time. Also what is newbie jail just heard it lol.Newbie restrictions are basically called newbie jail in forum terms LOLAs a newbie a user can not post image, make posts in between 360 seconds, can not PM users and many more things that I can not remember. All these restrictions combinedly called newbie jail ðŸ˜‚

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: I've only seen this while scraping the forum, normally it should be totally fine to open 10 tabs (or more) at once.I don't think this has anything to do with rank. Any chance there's a runaway process trying to get data from the forum? Or maybe someone uses the same Tor exit node to spam the forum.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on December 14, 2022, 08:04:34 AMQuote from: PX-Z on December 14, 2022, 07:37:50 AMIf the mentioned on the page is not what you are doing, then you might be using TOR? or having multiple tab opens? I am using TOR and not multiple tab opened. It was so annoying that I had to log out and now logged in again after long time. There was something with the server, let's see how the next hour works for me.I use Tor browser, but doesn't experience such problem even when i open few tabs.Quote from: LoyceV on December 14, 2022, 08:38:50 AMOr maybe someone uses the same Tor exit node to spam the forum.This forum use CloudFlare Onion service though, so it shouldn't be due to exit node.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on December 14, 2022, 08:38:50 AMAny chance there's a runaway process trying to get data from the forum? It's something the admin needs to check. That one hour was a pain for me. From last more than one hours it's working fine.QuoteOr maybe someone uses the same Tor exit node to spam the forum.Is it even possible? What odd we are looking at considering two or more people using same exit node for same website and not just that, they are obviously loading the pages at an unusual rate to get that error.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on December 14, 2022, 09:49:00 AMIs it even possible? What odd we are looking at considering two or more people using same exit node for same websiteGiven enough users, it's bound to happen eventually.Quoteand not just that, they are obviously loading the pages at an unusual rate to get that error.That's the weird part indeed.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Your account was once hacked if I'm correct. Maybe it has been hacked again lol. Hacker and you are accessing the account at the same time. Maybe that caused you the error. I can't see any other reason. Be aware mate, secure your account Â Quote from: LoyceV on December 14, 2022, 10:25:38 AMGiven enough users, it's bound to happen eventually.Would that happen if someone is logged in and other isn't. I think no though I'm not sure. In case of logged in users, it's very unlikely I think because only a very few person uses the forum through TOR (guess without stats).

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on December 14, 2022, 04:31:10 PMMaybe it has been hacked again lol. Hacker and you are accessing the account at the same time.No, this error comes from the webserver, before even knowing which account is used. It's IP-based.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: I've run into this issue a few times while deleting posts. Although, I always put it down my old laptop that was running on 8-12GB ram, and trying to run several virtual machines at once. Thus, potentially the requests were bundled up together. Interesting that you'd run into it on a normal computer setup. Since, I've now got a better laptop, and haven't run into this problem in a while. Specifically, I run into this when ctrl clicking the delete button. Since, I've removed the prompts. What exactly were you doing for this to ping up all the time?

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on December 14, 2022, 06:08:00 AMNo I am not. My men Theymos and Cyrus, What is going on?Since I logged in earlier, it keep coming when navigating to pages.. No idea if I will be able to post the topic as I do normally. Are we running out of resources or it's something new that is applied as a restriction? We had newbie jail, I guess it's not something to do with Legendary jail LOLI faced the same error 503 last year which i mentioned it here 503 Service Temporarily Unavailable, however in my case it says 503 Service temporary Unavailable while in your case it is saying a bit more precise error "Too fast / overloaded" but both error msgs have the same code 503.Also, this error has nothing to do with Legendary status, as anyone can face this issue. I would not call it an issue as a few minutes later it gets fixed automatically. A quick fix can be to close all the tabs, close the explorer or in some cases restart your computer.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Welsh on December 16, 2022, 07:00:30 PMctrl clicking the delete button.Isn't that the same as clicking the middle mouse button (usually the scroll wheel)? If so, you can save yourself more time

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Welsh on December 16, 2022, 07:00:30 PMWhat exactly were you doing for this to ping up all the time? Nothing except regular browsing that I have been doing all the years. It was just an average day. But the error was showing so many times that at some point it was bothering me to create the topic. It was weird though. I can not remember if I had the same problem before but that was the only time and since then the error did not show up again.I will be concluding with couple possible guesses that I can make from the whole discussion.1. It could be the forum server which was overloaded 2. The same tor exit node used by a group of people at the same time.Quote from: UmerIdrees on December 17, 2022, 05:11:08 AMAlso, this error has nothing to do with Legendary status, as anyone can face this issue.I was sarcastic knowing that nothing to do with any rank ðŸ˜‰. It was clearly a server side error. Anything 5xx means it's an issue coming from the server.
